description: black +‎ strap? Possible connection with Dutch stroop (“syrup”).

entries.meaning: The dark, viscous molasses remaining after maximum extraction of sugar from raw sugar cane, used in manufacturing and cattle feed.
(obsolete) A mixture of spirituous liquor (usually rum) and molasses.
examples: No blackstrap to-night; switchel, or ginger pop.

entries.meaning: (obsolete, nautical, slang) Bad port wine; any common wine of the Mediterranean.
